translation: Indeed, We have granted you, O Muhammad, al-Kawthar.
So pray to your Lord and sacrifice to Him alone.
Indeed, mankind is in loss.
Say, 'He is Allah, who is One.
Allah, the Eternal Refuge.
He neither begets nor is born.
Nor is there to Him any equivalent.
Then exalt [Him] with praise of your Lord.
Say, 'I seek refuge in the Lord of mankind.'
Say, 'I seek refuge in the Lord of daybreak.'
Competition in worldly increase diverts you.
No, if you only knew with knowledge of certainty.
Then you will surely be asked that Day about [your wordly] pleasures.
Indeed, mankind, to his Lord, is ungrateful.
Indeed, their Lord with them, that Day, is fully Aware.

arabic: فَمَن يَعْمَلْ مِثْقَالَ ذَرَّةٍ خَيْرًۭا يَرَهُۥ
translation: So whoever does an atom's weight of good will see it.

arabic: وَمَن يَعْمَلْ مِثْقَالَ ذَرَّةٍ شَرًّۭا يَرَهُۥ
translation: And whoever does an atom's weight of evil will see it.
Indeed, We sent it (the Qur'ān) down during the Night of Decree.

arabic: لَيْلَةُ ٱلْقَدْرِ خَيْرٌۭ مِّنْ أَلْفِ شَهْرٍۢ
translation: The Night of Decree is better than a thousand months.
Recite, and your Lord is the most Generous.
Indeed, to your Lord is the return.
